subject: Sales
title: Television: Selling Through the Screen
description: A micro-lesson that makes Television: Selling Through the Screen usable.

hook.text: The first TV ad aired in 1941 for Bulova watches. It cost nine dollars and changed advertising forever.

buildup.text: Television merged sight, sound, and motion. Products could be demonstrated live inside living rooms.

discovery.text: Soap operas got their name because soap companies sponsored entire shows to reach homemakers daily.

twist.text: TV spawned celebrity endorsement. A trusted face on screen could sell almost anything ‚Äî true or not.

climax.text: Television made advertising an entertainment form. The best commercials became as iconic as the shows.

punchline.text: TV turned selling into a visual spectacle.

quiz.question: Why are soap operas called 'soap' operas?
options: Soap companies sponsored them to reach daily audiences
The first one was set in a laundromat
